Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பொருளல் லவரைப் பொருளாகச் செய்யுங் பொருளல்லது இல்லை பொருள்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: There is nothing that can change people of no importance into those of (some) importance, besides wealth.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person of no consequence ('பொருளல்லவர்') is depicted as a faint, grey, almost invisible ghostly figure.
Layered_Composition.Midground: A stream of golden coins, representing Wealth ('பொருள்'), flows towards and into this figure.
Layered_Composition.Background: As the wealth fills them, the ghostly figure transforms into a solid, vibrant, and respected person of importance ('பொருளாகச் செய்யும்'). They are now taken seriously by the world. The image demonstrates that there is no greater transforming agent than wealth.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: There is no substance other than wealth that has the power to take a person of no account and make them into someone of account.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The transformation from a transparent ghost to a solid, respected figure is the central metaphor. The stream of gold is the catalyst for this transformation.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Transformative, powerful, materialistic, a commentary on social status.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The initial ghostly figure is grey and desaturated. The stream of gold is a brilliant, warm light. The final, solid figure is vibrant and richly colored.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that captures the entire transformation process in a single, flowing motion.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with high-quality ethereal and particle effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The light and color in the scene should grow as the person accumulates wealth.

Cultural_Anchors: Making the worthless worthy ('பொருளல்லவரைப் பொருளாகச் செய்யும்')
